author: William Mauldin
title: U.S. Names Key Partners That May Avoid Metals Tariffs for Now
text:
WASHINGTON—U. S. trade representative Robert Lighthizer told lawmakers Wednesday that several key U.S. allies and trading partners won’t face steel and aluminum tariffs until negotiations on possible tariff exemptions wrap up next month.
Mr. Lighthizer told a House of Representatives hearing that U.S. officials are in talks with countries from the European Union along with Australia and Argentina about exemptions from tariffs on steel and aluminum set to take effect Friday morning. 
...
